column4: Ok ... another question ... where the hell is my xorg.conf? It ain't in /etc/X11
I think I gotta cold reboot this darned box. Thanks all for the help!
you can add just the section you want over-ridden (from the autoconfigure) in the xorg.conf and ignore the rest. You don't need a full xorg.conf
Ok. But I have no idea what to write in it. I just thought I might find some help looking at the configuration.
